column3:
Do we need both TX_NULL and TX_NULL_DATA? Seems to me it should just be TX_NULL_DATA, and supporting that would (I think) be a one-line change:

```
mTemplates.insert(make_pair(TX_NULL_DATA, CScript() << OP_RETURN));
```

If we ever write higher-level code that extracts the data from a TX_NULL_DATA, that should be trivial-- remove the first byte/opcode from the ScriptPubKey, execute whatever
... wait, no, I'm wrong, mTemplates is a map, not a multimap...\nMaybe it should be a multimap, though.\n
@gavinandresen Regardless of map/multimap, I had the same thought.  TX_NULL_DATA can be defined as OP_RETURN, with optional trailing pushdata <= 80 bytes.\n

Well if we want to do that it'll need a separate code path in Solver(), similar to how P2SH is handled specially. I think you can make a (weak) argument that NULL and NULL_DATA make lives a little easier, because you always know that only the latter has data that your app should try to parse. (remember that it's legal to make a zero-byte PUSHDATA with 0x00)\n\nYou know, it's unfortunate that Satos

Huh?  This two-line change seems to work properly:

```
From d485640daee9ecbbdd3f39ca7ab1cda83b99c4a5 Mon Sep 17 00:00:00 2001
From: Gavin Andresen <gavinandresen@gmail.com>
Date: Thu, 24 Oct 2013 11:20:23 +1000
Subject: [PATCH] 0-byte OP_NULL_DATA

---
 src/script.cpp                 | 3 ++-
 src/test/transaction_tests.cpp | 4 ++++
 2 files changed, 6 insertions(+), 1 deletion(-)

di
@gavinandresen Oh, doh, yeah lets just do that + the bugfix and ScriptSigArgsExpected() change I made.\n
Now using multimap so there's just TX_NULL_DATA\n
